gurmukhi: cqur byd piTXM kIXo kwis bwsM ]Gny brK kIny qhwN hI invwsM ]52]
transliteration: Chatur Bed Pathiyan Kooyo Kaas(i) Baasan|| Ghane Barakh Koone Tahaan Hoo Nivaasan||52||
translation: They went to Kashi and real all the four Vedas. They lived there for many years.52.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk gRMQy lvI kuSI ju`D brnnM nwm qiRqIAw iDAwie smwpq msq suB msqu ]3]APjU ]189]
transliteration: It(i) Sri Bachitra Naatak Granthe Lavoo Koushoo Juddh Barnanan Naam Tritooa Dhiaae Samaapat Mast(u) Soubh Mast(u)||3||afjoo||189||
translation: End of the Third Chapter of BACHITTAR NATAK entitled The Description of the War of the Descendants of LAVA KUSHA.3.189.

gurmukhi: ijnY byd piTE su bydI khwey ]iqnY Drm ky krm nIky clwey ]
transliteration: Jinai Bed Pathio Su Bedoo Kahaae|| Tinai Dharam Ke Karam Nooke Chadhaae||
translation: Those who studied the Vedas, called Vedis (Bedis), they absorbed themselves in good acts of righteousness.

gurmukhi: pTy kwgdM m`dR rwjw suDwrM ]Apo Awp mo bYr BwvM ibswrM ]1]
transliteration: Pathe Kaagadan Maddra Raajaa Sudhaaran|| Apo Aap Mo Bair Bhaavan Bisaaran||1||
translation: The Sodhi king of Madra Desha (Punjab) sent letters to them, entreating them to forget the past enmities.1.

gurmukhi: niRpM mukilAM dUq so kwis AwXM ]sbY byidXM Byd BwKy sunwXM ]
transliteration: Nripan Moukalian Doot So Kaas(i) Aayan|| Sabai Bediyan Bhed Bhaakhe Sounaayan||
translation: The messengers sent by the king came to Kashi and gave the message to all the Bedis.

gurmukhi: sbY byd pwTI cly m`dR dysM ]pRxwmM kIXo Awn kY kY nrysM ]2]
transliteration: Sabai Bed Paathoo Chale Maddra Desan|| Pranaamannd Kooyo Aan Kaoo Daresan||2||
translation: All the reciters of the Vedas came to Madra Desha and made obeisance to the king.2.

gurmukhi: DunM byd kI BUp qwN krweI ]sbY pws bYTy sBw bIc BweI ]
transliteration: Dhounan Bed Koo Bhoop Taan Te Karaaoo|| Sabai Paas Baithe Sabhaa Boodhe Bhaaoo||
translation: The king caused them to recite the Vedas in the traditional manner and all the brethren (both Sodhis and Pelis) sat tohether.

gurmukhi: pVHy swm bydM jujr byd k`QM ]irgM byd piTXM kry Bwv h`QM ]3]
transliteration: Padhe Saam Bedan Jujar Bed Katthan|| Rigadg Bed Pathiyan Dare Bhaav Hatthan||3||
translation: Saam-Veda, Yajur-Veda and Rig-Ved were recited, the essence of the sayings was imbibed (by the king and his clan).3.

transliteration: Athar Bed Patthiyan|| Soune Paap Natthiyan||
Rahaa Roojh Raajaa|| Dooyaa Sarab Saajaa||4||
translation: The king was highly pleased and the bequeathed his kingdom to Bedis.4.
He himself adopted the sin-destroyer Vanaprastha Ashrama.
